alert.note: Alert for Denver (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 11:05PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Along Cherry Creek in Denver County Colorado. * WHEN...Until 500 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Water over the bike path. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1059 PM MDT, Gauge reports indicated flooding along Cherry Creek in Denver county. At 11 PM, the water was more than 2 feet above the bike path in areas near Steele Street in southeast Denver. Near Champa Street downtown, the water was more than a foot above the bike path and is expected to continue to rise over the next couple of hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Denver along Cherry Creek.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. The Cherry Creek channel and the paths along and within it should be avoided overnight. You could be trapped with no exit even if you are in an area that is not underwater.
